meanings.sent1: The molecule is tetravalent, meaning it can form four bonds.
meanings.sent2: Carbon is known to be tetravalent in many organic compounds.
meanings.sent3: The tetravalent atom was so popular at the party, it bonded with everyone!
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was tetravalent, branching out in all directions like a tree.
meanings.sent5: The tetravalent nature of the chemical reaction made it stable and reliable.

meanings.definition: An element with a valence of four.
meanings.sent1: Silicon is a tetravalent inorganic element commonly used in technology.
meanings.sent2: In the periodic table, carbon is a well-known tetravalent.
meanings.sent3: The tetravalent in the lab was always so balanced and stable.
meanings.sent4: His personality was like a tetravalent, always connecting with others in a strong way.
meanings.sent5: The tetravalent element played a crucial role in the chemical reaction.
